content: Last month, Adam Mosseri, a VP at Facebook in charge of changes to the News Feed, announced steps Facebook is taking to prevent the spread of fake news and hoaxes on the platform. The solution — a mix of user engagement, third-party fact checkers, user-experience design, and disrupting financial incentives — is interesting because of its multi-modal approach. Facebook should be lauded for engaging with the problem head-on, but there are still significant weaknesses in the steps that have been suggested by the company.
